meanings.definition: A person who adheres strictly to traditional methods or views.
meanings.sent1: The purists in the group only wanted to use old tools for the project.
meanings.sent2: The purists at the museum refused to accept any modern art pieces.
meanings.sent3: The purists insisted on using a typewriter instead of a computer for writing.
meanings.sent4: To the purists, technology was a threat to their traditional way of life.
meanings.sent5: The purists' dedication to ancient customs was unwavering.

meanings.definition: Those who insist on absolute correctness or purity in language.
meanings.sent1: The English purists corrected every grammar mistake they saw.
meanings.sent2: The purists in the debate club always used precise vocabulary.
meanings.sent3: The purists found humor in correcting others' pronunciation errors.
meanings.sent4: To the purists, language was a delicate and sacred art form.
meanings.sent5: The purists' quest for linguistic perfection was relentless.
